website_summaries.verdict: Certainly an acquired taste, The Evil Within is sure to satiate the horror fanatic. For those with an appetite for an investment-heavy exploit through the mind of a madman, The Evil Within is more than capable, even with a few bumps along the way.
pros: The Evil Within is an unforgiving survival horror game that looks great and features a number of different play styles
It's wonderfully morbid and twisted, sure to satisfy most horror junkies
cons: It's definitely not for everyone, especially the squeamish
There are few glitches peppered throughout and the overall difficulty may deter some prospective players

customer_reviews.title: Not scary, not fun
customer_reviews.text: Straight up boring, predictable and completely unintriguing while simultaneously being frustrating and unengaging. Played for about an hour and lost interest in being a character that limped around in sewage and was incapable of picking up anything useful in terms of defense. The character drops the knife he uses to cut himself free... Lame from that point on. Maybe " it gets better" but I don't intend to limp to that point.
customer_reviews.author: kenr

customer_reviews.title: Hard game, so I hear
customer_reviews.text: I am not a gamer, but I love horror and wanted to start playing some games so with some research I decided on this game. My boyfriend on the other hand is a big gamer, and he is good. He deemed this game one of the hardest he has ever played. Just my luck that it was what I decided on to "get into gaming". I really enjoyed watching, looked very fun!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Del Buono

customer_reviews.title: This game is LEGIT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This game is LEGIT!! I was a very big Resident Evil fan and this game reminds me of that franchise!! It takes a lot for a game to creep me out/give me goosebumps, and THIS game does that!! Very well done. Story line is great, and the game just flows! I just ordered The Evil Within 2!! I'm a fan of this franchise now!! Great graphics, weapons are awesome, and the zombie's and boss fights are great! I will say this as well...Whoever came up with this game, has one sick and twisted mind and I LOVE IT!!! Keep em coming!!
customer_reviews.author: ArmyMP73

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money..
customer_reviews.text: Just a total waste of time. The game was slow, and drawn out. The controls are glitchy, causing you to die.... A LOT. You're not left with much time to react, the lame main character is slow and super weak, you're not given much help with tips or advice, just trial and error and dying... A LOT. I get the whole "use what you can find, because you're limited!!" Shtick, but c'mon. It took my 6 attempts to smack a thing in the head with a bottle, and even then I died all 6 times I tried. Gave up, and threw the game out in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Brastrup

customer_reviews.title: A crazy hard game, but thoroughly enjoyable!
customer_reviews.text: For hardly more than the cost of a movie theater ticket, you, my friend, will receive exponentially more challenge, fun and excitement; more than anything your apt to take away from the passive, mindless dribble that one finds in the theaters today.
customer_reviews.author: AZ

customer_reviews.title: A masterpiece.
customer_reviews.text: Don't sleep on this game! I recently finished it for the first time years after it's original release and my only regret is not playing it sooner. Fans of Resident Evil 4 are in for a treat. Evil Within 1 is survival horror done right, and in my opinion, was ahead of it's time.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Interesting Blend of RE4 and psychological horror.
customer_reviews.text: Plays like RE4 but adds the darkness and confusion that comes with psychological horror. Its interesting for a good percentage of the game but eventually it begins to overstay its welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Evil Within is a good horror game.
customer_reviews.text: My best friend had this game on the PS4 and I liked it so I bought it for my XBOX ONE. And after playing it on my XBOX ONE this game was truly a gem. If I had to rate this game I would give it an 8.5 a really good horror game.
customer_reviews.author: Emmett North III

customer_reviews.title: Very good seller
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in excellent condition and sooner than expected. Although the game did not impact me as much as part two, I was curious to play the first part. Recommended, both the game and the seller ...

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game. Not For Young Children
customer_reviews.text: Very fun game. Horror game so I wouldn't recommend for younger children but I had a blast playing it.

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining
customer_reviews.text: A challenging 3rd person game, not a whole lot of direct attacks, majority of game is sneaking around enemies. Graphics are good, but not up to par compared to other recently released xbox one games. Mechanics are a little clunky also, but overall I would recommend this game if you like gory, edge of your seat horror. This game is VERY graphic so you should you discretion when playing around younger persons.

Story wise got a little stale and lost it, but comes back full circle in the end. If you played Resident Evil 4 or just want a solid horror game. Get this

customer_reviews.text: THIS GAME TREAT GAME IF YOU LIKE THE FIRST ONE

customer_reviews.title: Good title, tough times.
customer_reviews.text: Solid gameplay for fans of the genre. Turned out I wasn't one. Your ammo, as everyone says, is limited, and you are often forced to hide in order to survive. I just strongly suggest surviving... save points/checkpoints are sparse in this title. What I did love was how far ahead you have to think to dodge certain enemies, while still collecting items and passing story requirements!
customer_reviews.author: Kirbs

customer_reviews.title: Good but can be cheap at times
customer_reviews.text: The game was Retry good, only gripe is that it can be cheap at times. For example you can be faced with a horde of zombies and immediately after you kill them, be faced with a mini boss chainsaw guy, it's like the debs know where your low on ammo and use that as a chance to strike. Also so many trap!
customer_reviews.author: J.Bentley

customer_reviews.title: A true horror masterpiece.
customer_reviews.text: Did i smoke salvia? No i think i just played the most freakish intense game yet. Your hands will be sweaty and your mouth will be dry. Any problems you may be going thru will be irrelevant after playing as Sébastien. Its truly an immersive trippy hell.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Graphics are amazing, This game is not for the faint of ...
customer_reviews.text: Graphics are amazing, This game is not for the faint of heart or people with a weak stomach. The game play is fun and on the moment. I sort of felt like you need to have ADD to play this game and effectively learn it on the fly as random commands are shot up on the screen as events happen for a very short amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Samwise

customer_reviews.title: Very good game.
customer_reviews.text: This game reminds me a lot of Resident Evil 4. I've played every RE game except 6, and from what I've read, 6 is terrible. Evil Within is a creepy yet cool game. I like the exploration aspect and the little puzzles that are thrown at you. This is the type of game that keeps me coming back for more. If you like survival horror type games, this game is a must try.
customer_reviews.author: Keith M

customer_reviews.title: Immersive and challenging
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this game from beginning to end. Excellent story and enough of a challenge (survival mode) to keep me coming back until I finished it. It took me about 26 hours to complete and that was with a fair amount of exploring. It is one of the rare games I could see myself replaying as well.

customer_reviews.text: There are few titles that can match this kind of horror genre. Definitely, some Resident Evil titles entirely missed the menacing feel and look, deeply woven into this game.

Can't wait for the next one. Tense moments, decent story, and good weapon selection. Has some replay ability once you beat it through the first time.

The scares are at times predictable but there are very tense moments. All in all i would say any fans of survival horror shouldn't go wrong with this game. Probably more of a rent than a buy but not a bad game at all.

customer_reviews.title: The Review Within
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid game. The control scheme takes a little getting used to, but all in all this is a great game for the survival horror genre. Conserve your ammo. Use sneak attacks, and stay in the shadows. Some negative points. There do appear to be some glitches with the recognition from enemies, and some times the escape routes are not straight forward enough which can cause major frustration with the way the game saves, and sets your spawn points back. You'll find yourself repeating a lot of things, but this can be overlooked, and may come with patches to prevent such nuisances in the future. Guaranteed to scare you! Thanks, Bucky Wilson www.facebook.com/bucky5676

customer_reviews.title: I just don't like these Japanese horror stories
customer_reviews.text: I just don't like these Japanese horror stories. I love survival horror, but the story is as boring as listening to someone's dream. Anything can happen, and why not? Because we won't bother explaining it, we don't have to. LOOK OUT! A 6 legged woman! Run! HA! We're awesome. Good graphics, but repetitive. It's very stage oriented. All in all, when it comes to horror games, this is a B-flick. Take it for what it's worth, as for me, it will gather dust until I get bored.

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh
customer_reviews.text: This game has a cool concept, but there's a lot of glitches. For example we have gotten "stuck" next to a wall where the character just started glitching out. Also it has freaked out during a killing where the killing kept repeating over and over with no way to go on. I will say this...this game is hard. I am no newby to games, but there were some spots you have to do 15+ times to get through and it's very frustrating. The game is scary, I will say that, so that's a plus. I'm just not super impressed overall.

customer_reviews.title: overall review
customer_reviews.text: This game doesnt hold back on the gore. Its rated M for a reason parents. Not for kids by any perspective you look at it. I wish the tutorial fully explained things. You use the sneak button to go into lockers. Yet the action button is a differnt button. It is not clear on that or i fell asleep during that screen (sarcasm). Its annoying at times when you cant figure out where to go. I suppose they were trying to make it realistic. Like he doesnt know where to go, so you should as well.

customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: I'm not into games where you have to do everything ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not into games where you have to do everything perfectly to advance and not use any creativity of your own. This is just a sneak and strike title that is vastly too difficult for what it's worth. I don't mind a game being difficult, but when it has torch wielding zombies who also setup trip wires and bombs, it's obvious that the game designers were more interested in torturing the player than making a compelling game. Not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Baird

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness

customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: The game didn't grab me the way I wanted it to. I was very hopeful given it's production team, but it just didn't work. I found the controls stiff and the camera wonky. Maybe I wasn't playing it right. It had spooky atmosphere, but by the time I got to the early outdoor areas, I just didn't like the sneaking around and nigh invulnerable enemies. I love horror games normally, but this one was too heavy on the stealth, too punishing and unforgiving, and a little more than cliched.
customer_reviews.author: Antknee

customer_reviews.title: I loved the game a lot
customer_reviews.text: I loved the game a lot. It's old school survival horror. Pays a lot of tribute to resident evil. Also it came with the fighting chance pack.

customer_reviews.title: Needs To Be Played With A Controller
customer_reviews.text: The story line is great. But the controls are abysmal, if you're used to playing mainly with mouse and keyboard. You're allowed to remap some, but not all, functions. This port from consoles needs to be played with an X-Box like controller unless you're OK wrestling with special function keys scattered all over the keyboard. I'll continue to push forward, as so far the story interest just overcomes the inconvenient play controls.

customer_reviews.author: Ke'Shaun

customer_reviews.title: f***ed up game
customer_reviews.text: I usually like Bethesda, but this gameplay is so choppy and not smooth, its not fun. Nothing makes sense in it and it is just a hugely f****ed up game. I regret buying, save youself the money and dont buy it
customer_reviews.author: Silver

customer_reviews.title: If you like Resident Evil you will groove on this stuff
customer_reviews.text: If you like Resident Evil you will groove on this stuff. Scary, but not tooooo scary. Just the right amount, IMO. Very nice art direction and gameplay even on casual mode. There will be chainsaws.
customer_reviews.author: UofFry

customer_reviews.title: Got the game quickly and at the price I paid ...
customer_reviews.text: Got the game quickly and at the price I paid well worth a different version of RE4, I know it's the evil within however, The Evil Within reminds me of RE4, needless to say; the game is worth it at around 20 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: A very slow and methodical game. It does not ...
customer_reviews.text: A very slow and methodical game. It does not offer the fast pace and shooting zombies as expected from the commercial. Instead you are required to really think and find exits without and tips or advice. Took me two days just to pass the beginning level due to it lack of information on how to move on
customer_reviews.author: ricardo cardona

product_meta.title: The Evil Within - Xbox One
product_meta.description:
Platform:Xbox One| Edition:Standard

view larger THE EVIL WITHIN


> Developed by Shinji Mikami -- creator of the seminal Resident Evil series -- and the talented team at Tango Gameworks™, The Evil Within™ embodies the meaning of pure survival horror. Experience a disturbing reality as you try to break free from warped machinations that could only exist in the most horrifying worlds. Face twisted creatures and experience true terror, all heightened by cutting edge lighting and animation made possible by a customized version of the id Tech 5 engine. 


view larger Story:


>  While investigating the scene of a gruesome mass murder, Detective Sebastian Castellanos and his partners encounter a mysterious and powerful force. After seeing the slaughter of fellow officers, Sebastian is ambushed and knocked unconscious. When he awakens, he finds himself in a deranged world where hideous creatures wander among the dead. Facing unimaginable terror, and fighting for survival, Sebastian embarks on a frightening journey to unravel what’s behind this evil force.


PURE SURVIVAL HORROR RETURNS


> Shinji Mikami, the father of survival horror, is back to direct a chilling new game wrapped in haunting narrative. Tension and anxiety heighten dramatically as you explore the game’s tortured world. You’ll have limited resources at your disposal as you fight for your survival and experience profound fear in this perfect blend of horror and action.


BRUTAL TRAPS AND TWISTED CREATURES


> Face unthinkable horrors and cruel traps as you struggle to survive against overwhelming odds. Turn evil against itself by using the same diabolical devices against overwhelming deadly creatures.


UNKNOWN THREATS IN AN UNCERTAIN WORLD


> Mysterious and wicked fears loom ahead in a world that warps and twists around you. Corridors, walls, doors, and entire buildings change in real-time, ensnaring players in a reality where threats can appear at any time and from any direction.


THE NEW FACE OF HORROR


> Highly-crafted environments, horrifying anxiety, and an intricate story weave together to create an immersive world that will bring players to the height of tension. Defeat insurmountable terror and experience the ultimate thrill by discovering The Evil Within.



view larger view larger view larger view larger
feature_bullets: Pure Survival Horror Returns - Shinji Mikami, the father of survival horror, is back to direct a chilling new game wrapped in haunting narrative; Tension and anxiety heighten dramatically as you explore the game's tortured world

Brutal Traps and Twisted Creatures - Face unthinkable horrors and cruel traps as you struggle to survive against overwhelming odds; Turn evil against itself by using the same diabolical devices against overwhelming deadly creatures
Unknown Threats in an Uncertain World - Mysterious and wicked fears loom ahead in a world that warps and twists around you
The New Face of Horror - Highly-crafted environments, horrifying anxiety, and an intricate story weave together to create an immersive world that will bring players to the height of tension
